title: Popper Hemmingway
body:
I only have 10 minutes to make a post, so I'm going to make this quick:

Yesterday I decided it would be a good idea to clean the popper, because the rumor is that most people (Nicole excluded) like clean popcorn out of clean poppers. So, the first thing I did was consult the internets. I made a post on film-tech asking for advice on how to clean the popper.

*Gagh... running out of time*

Long story short, the people at film-tech suggested I use oven cleaner, which I did. Fast forward six hours, and now the inside of our kettle is black? I scrub and scrub and scrub, but the strange black film won't go away. I then sanitize the kettle with boiling water and a USDA approved kettle cleaning agent... twice. I open the lid... still black. Super clean, but still black. This all happened yesterday.

So today I wake up at 6:00 AM and within 15 minutes I'm leaving Wal-Mart with extra strength steel wool, oxygenated brillo pads, Gojo, concentrated grease-cutting dish soap, plastic putty knifes, a wire brush, and one of those curly silver dish scrubbers. By 8:30 AM, after using painful amounts of elbow grease, the kettle was finally back to the way it looked yesterday. Two days of work and all I have to show for it is a right arm that's disproportionately larger than my left. After the scouring was through, I sanitized the kettle twice more (in fact, the last application of sanitizer is still sitting in the kettle... sanitizing as we speak).

After the whole kettle ordeal, I drove back home, took Bogey to the groomers, drove out to my parent's house (18 miles SW of Springfield), borrowed two big table's for First Friday, drove back to Springfield, went to the theater, re-sanitized the kettle, straightened up the front of the building, set up the tables, drove to Springfield Paper Company, bought 500 small white paper bags, went to the popcorn distribution place, bought some popcorn and a scoop, drove back to the groomers, picked up Bogey, came back home, wrote this post...

And that's where I find myself right now. Uh oh, time's up. Nicole's home. We still have a ton, ton, TON to do to get ready for tonight. Be there or be square!

More later.
author: Dan

comments.author: nicholas
comments.body: This will sound dumb, but it used to work when I had to clean shit like that at McDonalds. Warm it up, then turn it off...when it's still warm (but won't burn you), wad up a big wad of cling-wrap, and use the cling-wrap to wipe it down. Don't ask me how or why (I don't understand the physics of it) but it works. Well, it's worked for me in the past.

comments.author: Kirsten
comments.body: Dan, the popcorn popper kettle will blacken and it's OK.  Wipe the kettle with a paper towel (dry) after each use.  Gently wipe down the insides of the glass with a mixture of vinegar/water and clean the light bulb (after it cools).  I've broke more than a few!  You don't have to make it sparkling clean for every single popping. It's not worth it, I tried it, it's crazy and you will go insane!  We gave away FREE popcorn from our big popper for years, until the health department decided we had to have like 3 sinks instead of 1.  Sold our popper, wasn't gonna put in another two sinks to give away free stuff.  Hope your First Friday went well, I was in Florida couldn't make it.  You guys are getting closer!
